title: Peter Bosz reveals he spied on Louis van Gaal's training session at rivals... but it was all in vain
text:
Peter Bosz has revealed that he took part in a 'dangerous' spying mission on Louis van Gaal's Ajax when he was a player at Feyenoord.

Feyenoord instructed Bosz to spy on an Ajax training session in the 1990s, but the midfielder wasn't able to glean any useful information due to the fact that he couldn't hear what van Gaal was saying.

Bosz told DAZN: 'It was dangerous because Ajax and Feyenoord are like cats and dogs.

Peter Bosz revealed that he spied on an Ajax training session when he was a Feyenoord player

'Unfortunately, I couldn't hear from inside the car what Van Gaal said to his players.

'That was a pity because communication is a key for van Gaal. I did not find out that much.'

The rivalry between Feyenoord and Ajax is intense, and is referred to as De Klassieker.

Louis van Gaal was in charge of Ajax at the time, but Bosz couldn't hear what he was saying

Bosz subsequently entered management himself and is now in charge of Bayer Leverkusen

Bosz is now the manager of Bayer Leverkusen, having previously had a spell in charge of Borussia Dortmund.

Last season Leeds were fined £200,000 by the English Football League for watching their opponents train prior to games.

The punishment came after a member of Leeds staff was seen acting suspiciously outside of Derby's training ground in January before the sides faced each other.
description: Former Feyenoord midfielder Peter Bosz has revealed that he took part in a 'dangerous' spying mission on Ajax, managed by Louis van Gaal, in the 1990s.
